hints.content: Start by understanding the two valid formats for phone numbers: (xxx) xxx-xxxx and xxx-xxx-xxxx. Each 'x' represents a digit (0-9). Make sure you can identify these patterns in a string.
Consider using regular expressions (regex) to match these patterns. Regex allows you to define a search pattern for strings, which is perfect for validating phone numbers.
For the first format (xxx) xxx-xxxx, note that it begins with an opening parenthesis, followed by three digits, a closing parenthesis, a space, three more digits, a hyphen, and finally four digits.

In the second format, xxx-xxx-xxxx, the phone number starts with three digits, followed by a hyphen, then three more digits, another hyphen, and ends with four digits. Pay attention to the placement of hyphens and spaces.
When constructing your regex pattern, remember to escape special characters like parentheses and hyphens. For example, in regex, you would write \( for an opening parenthesis.
You can combine both formats into a single regex pattern using the OR operator '|'. This allows you to match either of the two valid formats in one go.

Make sure to test your regex pattern with various inputs to ensure it correctly identifies valid phone numbers and ignores invalid ones. Consider edge cases such as numbers with extra spaces or incorrect digit counts.
Think about how you will read from the file and process each line. You can use a loop or a command that reads each line and applies your regex pattern to check for validity.
Remember that the output should only include valid phone numbers. You might want to use a command that filters out invalid matches after applying your regex.
Finally, combine all of your commands into a one-liner bash script. Use tools like grep or awk along with your regex to achieve the desired output format directly from the command line.

questionNotes: Valid phone numbers must be in the formats (xxx) xxx-xxxx or xxx-xxx-xxxx.
Each line in the text file must not contain leading or trailing white spaces.
Output should only include valid phone numbers, one per line.
